# Global Equity Total Return Index

## 1. Overview

The Global Equity Total Return Index measures the performance of large and mid-cap stocks across developed markets worldwide.

## 2. Universe

The index covers stocks from the following regions:
- North America
- Europe
- Asia Pacific

Country classification follows the standard market classification framework.

## 3. Calculation

The index is calculated in real-time during market hours. The calculation uses prices from the primary exchange for each security.

End-of-day index values are published after market close. Values are calculated to six decimal places.

## 4. Data Sources

### 4.1 Price Data
Prices are obtained from our data vendor. Real-time prices use the consolidated tape where available.

### 4.2 Corporate Actions
Corporate action data is sourced from multiple providers and reconciled internally.

### 4.3 Foreign Exchange
FX rates for currency conversion use WM/Reuters rates at the fixing time.

### 4.4 Reference Data
Security reference data including identifiers, classification, and fundamental data comes from the standard industry sources.

## 5. Currency Hedging (Hedged Variants)

Hedged variants are available. The hedging ratio and roll schedule follow our standard hedging methodology.

## 6. Dividends

Gross dividends are reinvested on the ex-date. Withholding tax assumptions follow the standard assumptions for institutional investors.

## 7. Index Review

The index is reviewed quarterly. Changes are announced with appropriate notice.
